intro: Farsetia aegyptia subsp. edgeworthii, commonly known as the Egyptian farsetia, is a rare and ornamental plant native to arid regions of North Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, palmate leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xerophytic gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
